holidays.name: World Bee Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the role of bees and other pollinators in nature and agriculture, highlighting their importance to global ecosystems and food production.
holidays.origin: Declared by the United Nations in 2017, May 20 was chosen to honor the birthday of Anton Jan≈°a, a pioneer of modern beekeeping from Slovenia.
holidays.funFact: Without bees, one-third of the food we eat would disappear since they pollinate about 70% of the world's major food crops!

holidays.name: Towel Day
holidays.description: Fans of Douglas Adams honor the author by carrying a towel with them all day, celebrating the beloved sci-fi series 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy'.
holidays.origin: Started in 2001, two weeks after Adams‚Äô death, an homage to his famous advice that a towel is the most useful thing an interstellar hitchhiker can have.
holidays.funFact: In the book, a towel is called 'about the most massively useful thing an interstellar hitchhiker can have', earning it legendary status among fans.

holidays.name: National Endangered Species Day (USA)
holidays.description: A day to recognize and appreciate endangered species and support efforts to protect and conserve threatened wildlife.
holidays.origin: Established in 2006 by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, observed annually on the third Friday of May, which often falls on or near May 20.
holidays.funFact: Since 1973, the Endangered Species Act has saved more than 99% of the species under its care from extinction.

holidays.name: Pick Strawberries Day
holidays.description: A fun seasonal food celebration encouraging people to enjoy fresh strawberries, whether by picking them, eating them, or making delicious treats.
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday rising from the love of spring fruit harvests in temperate climates.
holidays.funFact: Strawberries aren‚Äôt berries botanically, but aggregate fruits formed from several smaller fruits on a single flower!
